title: Graves seems a little OP
body:
1. Decent early game, only really rough against Caitlyn. 
2. Strong mid game (can out burst almost any ADC 1v1, Q + R is just so strong, this is provided you haven't fell behind 15 cs, if you have you can still get a kill but need a hard cc support such as Blitz/Leona to help you)
3. A passive which endlessly scales into the late game
4. Great waveclear with q (also R if it is absolutely crucial)
5. Graves r is easy to land on a lot of people, it deals tonnes of damage,  and there is even some extra range of burst damage at the end (allows you to snipe runners) 
6. Has a dash which gives you a pretty decent **as **steroid for an early/mid game champion. 
7. At full build he can 100-0 most ADCs/APCs 1v1 with his q/r burst along with e **as** steroid. (exception may be a vayne who gets a good condemn off, or a trist which escapes instantly, please note if you get lucky crits and have used your e steroid + q and r, you may be able to kill them almost instantly)
8. aoe w smoke screen to disturb their frontline and allow for your team to get free shots off on them, as if they are a blind old man without his walking stick. 

Cons:
Slightly shorter range
Once behind 30 cs or so, it is hard to come back if your support cannot initiate on their ADC, especially if thy are playing a ranged/mobile one like Trist/Cait/Kalista. 
Using e to deal more damage (can put you in a very dangerous position)
Mana costs are a bit of an issue, but easily solved with one mana pot per back.

replies.body:
1. his pre-6 is actually nowhere near as good as other adcs
2. yes his mid game is strong, that's his power spike
3. his passive makes only a very small difference
4. nearly every adc has good wave clear
5. most ults are very easy to land
6. his dash is decent at best
7. no he cant
8. Don't get hit by smokescreen.

my favourite champ is Cait so when i see a graves, naturally i %%%% myself to begin with BUT...
the trick i do against a graves is just to use my infinite range to stay well clear and get my net first. so when he does decide to burst in i can get out of it pretty easily (as long as there isnt a enemy blitz or thresh to grab/hook me) and also recall alot more, it make get me behind in cs but easier to farm then come back from a deathstreak against a fed graves (talk about living nightmare T.T). 
graves just naturally has great mid game because thats when he spikes. cait has great start-game so i use that to my advantage.
so always play to your ADC's strengths to compensate for their weaknesses.

He's no where near op.

He's actually just in a really good spot at the moment.
